explanation: The report is correct. Given the provided macro definition LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0), the expression assigned to err is always 0. The subsequent if (err) therefore has an invariant (always-false) controlling expression. MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 prohibits invariant controlling expressions (none of the listed exceptions apply here), so this use violates the rule in the shown translation unit. (Note: although the macro contains (void)cfg and so is not an "integer constant expression" by strict C syntax, the comma-expression always yields 0 at runtime in this build, which is what makes the controlling expression invariant.)
